page.title: 02LANDSCAPE Longton District
page.content: { }Longton Moss is the name and nature of this district , which is part of the WEST LANCASHIRE plain. The land is very wet, and is artificially drained. It is good for potatoes, carrots and roses with glasshouses to grow lettuce and tomatoes, and some grain is grown here now.{ The Western area is mainly pasture and the East is arable. Much of the land is used by horses; there are two riding schools, one horse trainer and one racing stable within the plot. { { }The soil is basically{clay}and until recently this was excavated to make bricks. The derelict site became a nature reserve with{tern}using the flooded pits. This year the owners decided to fill in some of the pits and houses will be built on the site. { } { }
